column2: I might learn new actions by taking a dance class or trying out a sport I have never done before. Learning new actions is not unusual
column4: their day-to-day actions are not so different from what they have done in the past. On the other hand
column5: babies are constantly learning new things. They are discovering new objects
column6: learning to move in new ways
column7: and playing with new toys. You probably do not remember
column8: but when you were a baby
column9: you started out able to move your hands and arms but did not have much control over how you reached for new toys and played with them. Within the first year of life
column10: babies are learning how to do lots of things themselves
column11: but they are also figuring out how and why other people do things.
